intro: Drymophloeus oninensis, commonly known as the Oninensis Ironwood, is a tropical tree native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dense, hard wood and evergreen foliage. The plant typically grows in humid, lowland forests and is known for its slow growth rate. It has small, oval-shaped leaves and produces small, white flowers followed by orange-red fruits. Due to its ecological importance and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species.
